intro: Henckelia monantha, commonly known as the white-flowered henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Henckelia monantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
